results.title: Taliban Quash Protests and Seize Enemies, Tightening Grip on Afghanistan
results.abstract: The Taliban’s actions and history of brutality cast doubt on their promises of amnesty, and many Afghans are afraid to venture out of their homes.
results.byline: By Carlotta Gall, Marc Santora and Richard Pérez-Peña

results.title: Seeking Global Recognition, Taliban Take a New Approach: Making Nice

results.title: Biden Says Troops May Stay in Kabul Longer to Assist Evacuations
results.abstract: Tens of thousands of people trying to flee remain in the country, unable to leave.
results.byline: By Eric Schmitt, Helene Cooper and Michael D. Shear
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

multimedia.caption: People trying to flee the country gathering in front of the airport in Kabul, Afghanistan. Pentagon leaders stopped short of assuring safe passage to Afghan allies who have been blocked by the Taliban from reaching the airport.
multimedia.copyright: Jim Huylebroek for The New York Times

results.title: British Court Denies Last-Ditch Effort to Save Geronimo, the Divisive Alpaca
results.abstract: Helen Macdonald said she has until 4:30 p.m. Thursday to put him down herself or agricultural authorities, who fear bovine tuberculosis, can show up to kill him at any time.

results.title: Intelligence Agencies Did Not Predict Imminence of Afghan Collapse, Officials Say
results.abstract: The acknowledgment came as the Biden administration faces heavy criticism over its handling of the withdrawal of American-led forces from Afghanistan.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces
org_facet: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

results.title: Biden says U.S. troops may stay longer if needed for evacuations.
results.abstract: In an interview with ABC News, the president said the chaos in Afghanistan had been unavoidable.
